title: Arnold Schwarzenegger reveals the Terminator has an unexpected day job
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Arnold Schwarzenegger has revealed that the Terminator has a rather unexpected job in the upcoming Dark Fate film.

Though we might associate the Terminator with doing much more dramatic things, like being a time-travelling assassin set out to rescue the world from Skynet once and for all, it turns out we’ve all got to make a living somehow.

During an appearance on The Graham Norton Show, Arnold revealed that one of the ways upcoming film Terminator: Dark Fate rewrites the history of the franchise is by explaining what his T-800 character has been doing since Terminator 2: Judgement Day.

Whereas recent Terminator films have been set in alternate timelines to the well-loved first movie, the latest Terminator installment, Terminator: Dark Fate, is a direct sequel to James Cameron’s original two films, The Terminator and Terminator 2: Judgment Day.

‘The Terminator has been, you know, around,’ Arnie joked. ‘He has been terminating things, busy, working overtime!

‘Also, at the same time, he has lived now enough time with human beings that he actually has acquired some kind of human behaviours.’

The actor revealed that, in order to go unnoticed in human society, the Terminator had to get a job, one that probably involves selling curtains and fabrics.

‘In order to infiltrate, and in order to blend in, I’m a drapery salesman,’ Schwarzenegger revealed. ‘That’s actually Jim Cameron’s idea, but I then developed the character a little bit more and improvised some of the lines.’

So, if you’re ever in need of saving the planet and buying a lovely new piece of decorative cloth for your home in the process, we guess you now know who to call.

Terminator: Dark Fate will hit cinemas on Wednesday 23 October 2019.
